messages.content: You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Left Hue Light
ID: ZB31965_011_1
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [100]
        Unknown [101]
    On Level
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Previous [101]
      Range 0 to 255 Unit Level
    Ramp Rate
      Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds
    Responding
      Enum
        True [0]
        False [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    On [DON]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            Previous [101]
          Range 0 to 255 Unit Level
        Parameter 2: Ramp Rate [RR]
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds
    Off [DOF]
    Fast On [DFON]
    Fast Off [DFOF]
    Toggle [TOGGLE]
    Brighten [BRT]
    Dim [DIM]
    On Level [OL]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            Previous [101]
          Range 0 to 255 Unit Level
    Ramp Rate [RR]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds
    Identify [IDENTIFY]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 65535 Unit seconds
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Can you turn on the Left Hue Light to level 200 with a ramp rate of 5 seconds?

To turn on the Left Hue Light to a specific brightness level, the device accepts the On command [DON] with two parameters: Parameter 1 is the level, which can be an enum Off [0], Previous [101], or any value in the range 0 to 255 (Unit Level). Parameter 2 is the ramp rate in seconds, ranging from 0.0 to 6553.0 seconds.

You requested level 200 and ramp rate 5 seconds, both within the allowed ranges.

Command to send:
- Command Name: On [DON]
- Parameter 1: 200 (Unit Level), Range: 0 to 255
- Parameter 2: 5.0 (Unit seconds), Range: 0.0 to 6553.0

I will proceed with this command to turn on the Left Hue Light accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Ecobee - Office
ID: n002_t421800120477
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range -50.0 to 150.0 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
    Heat Setpoint
      Range 32 to 90 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Cool Setpoint
      Range 32 to 90 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Mode
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Heat [1]
        Cool [2]
        Auto [3]
        Aux/Emergency Heat [4]
        Resume [5]
        Fan Only [6]
        Furnace [7]
        Dry Air [8]
        Moist Air [9]
        Auto Changeover [10]
        Energy Save Heat [11]
        Energy Save Cool [12]
        Away [13]
        Program Auto [14]
        Program Heat [15]
        Program Cool [16]
    Fan Mode
      Enum
        Auto [0]
        On [1]
    Humidity
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Relative Humidity
  ***Accept Commands***
    Heat Setpoint [CLISPH]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 32 to 90 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Cool Setpoint [CLISPC]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 32 to 90 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Mode [CLIMD]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            Heat [1]
            Cool [2]
            Auto [3]
            Aux/Emergency Heat [4]
            Resume [5]
            Fan Only [6]
            Furnace [7]
            Dry Air [8]
            Moist Air [9]
            Auto Changeover [10]
            Energy Save Heat [11]
            Energy Save Cool [12]
            Away [13]
            Program Auto [14]
            Program Heat [15]
            Program Cool [16]
    Fan Mode [CLIFS]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Auto [0]
            On [1]

USER QUERY:
What is the current temperature and humidity in the Ecobee Office?

The Ecobee - Office device provides properties for Temperature and Humidity. Temperature is measured in Fahrenheit with a range from -50.0 to 150.0 degrees, and Humidity is given as a percentage from 0 to 100% relative humidity.

Since you asked for the current temperature and humidity, I will provide the values of these properties.

Property values:
- Temperature: (value as per device reading) °F
- Humidity: (value as per device reading) % Relative Humidity

Please note that the exact values depend on the current sensor readings from the device.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Right Hue Color Hue-Sat
ID: ZB24569_011_106
  ***Properties***
    Hue
      Range 0 to 65534 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Saturation
      Range 0.0 to 1.0 Unit Raw (step of 1.0 and precision of 3).
    Enhanced Hue
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [100]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Move To [MOVETO]
        Parameter 1: Hue [HUE]
          Range 0.0 to 360.0 Unit Hue Degree
        Parameter 2: Saturation [SAT]
          Range 0.0 to 100.0 Unit % (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
        Parameter 3: Duration [DUR]
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Move To Hue [MOVETOHUE]
        Parameter 1: Hue [HUE]
          Range 0.0 to 360.0 Unit Hue Degree
        Parameter 2: Direction [DIR]
          Range 0 to 3 Unit Index
            Shortest Distance [0]
            Longest Distance [1]
            Up [2]
            Down [3]
        Parameter 3: Duration [DUR]
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Move To Saturation [MOVETOSAT]
        Parameter 1: Saturation [SAT]
          Range 0.0 to 100.0 Unit % (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
        Parameter 2: Duration [DUR]
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Move Hue [MOVEHUE]
        Parameter 1: Mode [MODE]
          Enum
            Stop [0]
            Up [1]
            Down [3]
        Parameter 2: Rate [RATE]
          Range 1 to 65535 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Move Saturation [MOVESAT]
        Parameter 1: Mode [MODE]
          Enum
            Stop [0]
            Up [1]
            Down [3]
        Parameter 2: Rate [RATE]
          Range 1 to 255 Unit Raw (step of 1 and precision of 1).
    Step Hue [STEPHUE]
        Parameter 1: Mode [MODE]
          Enum
            Up [1]
            Down [3]
        Parameter 2: Step Size [SIZE]
          Range 0.0 to 360.0 Unit Hue Degree
        Parameter 3: Duration [DUR]
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Step Saturation [STEPSAT]
        Parameter 1: Mode [MODE]
          Enum
            Up [1]
            Down [3]
        Parameter 2: Step Size [SIZE]
          Range 0.0 to 100.0 Unit % (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
        Parameter 3: Duration [DUR]
          Range 0.0 to 6553.0 Unit seconds (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Stop [STOP]
    Enhanced Hue [EHUE]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Enum
            Off [0]
            On [100]
    Query [QUERY]

USER QUERY:
Set the Right Hue Color Hue-Sat to hue 180 degrees and saturation 75% over 10 seconds.

The Right Hue Color Hue-Sat device accepts the Move To [MOVETO] command to set both hue and saturation simultaneously. The parameters are:
- Hue [HUE]: Range 0.0 to 360.0 degrees
- Saturation [SAT]: Range 0.0 to 100.0 %
- Duration [DUR]: Range 0.0 to 6553.0 seconds

Your request is to set hue to 180 degrees and saturation to 75% over 10 seconds, which are all within the allowed ranges.

Therefore, the command to send is:
- Command Name: Move To [MOVETO]
- Parameter 1: Hue = 180.0 (Unit Hue Degree), Range: 0.0 to 360.0
- Parameter 2: Saturation = 75.0 (Unit %), Range: 0.0 to 100.0
- Parameter 3: Duration = 10.0 (Unit seconds), Range: 0.0 to 6553.0

I will execute this command to adjust the color accordingly.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: AudioPlayer
ID: n004_0
  ***Properties***
    Playing Status
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Idle [0]
        Playing [1]
    Playing
      Range 0 to 100 Unit Index
        None [0]
        Religious [1]
        Sky and Sabzi [2]
        Farsi [3]
        Uncle Nader [4]
        Classical [5]
        Vocal [6]
        Opera [7]
        Mine [8]
        Sia [9]
        Home Friends [10]

        Pop [12]
        Shmu Music [13]
        Friends [14]
        bm [15]
        Instrumental [16]
        Favorites [17]
        Euro [18]
        Maman [19]
    Bluetooth
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Output
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        Speaker Jack [0]
        Bluetooth [1]
    Volume
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Shuffle
      Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
        No [0]
        Yes [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Play [PLAY]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit Index
            None [0]
            Religious [1]
            Sky and Sabzi [2]
            Farsi [3]
            Uncle Nader [4]
            Classical [5]
            Vocal [6]
            Opera [7]
            Mine [8]
            Sia [9]
            Home Friends [10]
            Hebrew [11]
            Pop [12]
            Shmu Music [13]
            Friends [14]
            bm [15]
            Instrumental [16]
            Favorites [17]
            Euro [18]
            Maman [19]
    Shuffle [SHUFFLE]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
            No [0]
            Yes [1]
    Previous [PREVIOUS]
    Stop [STOP]
    Next [NEXT]
    Output [OUTPUT]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 1 Unit Index
            Speaker Jack [0]
            Bluetooth [1]
    Volume [VOLUME]
        Parameter 1:  []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %

USER QUERY:
Please play the "Classical" playlist on the AudioPlayer and set the volume to 50%.

The AudioPlayer device accepts the Play [PLAY] command with a parameter specifying the playlist to play. The playlist parameter is an index from 0 to 100 with predefined values, where Classical corresponds to 5.

Additionally, the Volume [VOLUME] command accepts a parameter from 0 to 100 percent to set the volume level.

Your request is to play the Classical playlist and set the volume to 50%, both within the allowed ranges.

Commands to send:
1. Play [PLAY]
   - Parameter 1: 5 (Classical), Range: 0 to 100
2. Volume [VOLUME]
   - Parameter 1: 50 (%), Range: 0 to 100

I will execute these commands to start playing the Classical playlist at 50% volume.
You are a smart home assistant.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Climate Info
ID: n003_climate5rf7219
  ***Properties***
    Cabin Temperature
      Range -50.0 to 75.0 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
      Range -50.0 to 150.0 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Outdoor Temperature
      Range -50.0 to 75.0 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
      Range -50.0 to 150.0 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Driver Side Temp Setting
      Range -50.0 to 75.0 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
      Range -50.0 to 150.0 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
    Passenger Side Temp Setting
      Range -50.0 to 75.0 Unit Celsius (step of 0.5 and precision of 1).
      Range -50.0 to 150.0 Unit Fahrenheit (step of 1.0 and precision of 1).
  ***Accept Commands***
    Cabin Temperature [CABINTEMP]
        Parameter 1: Driver side Temp [driver]
        Parameter 2: Passenger side Temp [passenger]

USER QUERY:
Set the cabin temperature to 72 degrees Fahrenheit for both driver and passenger sides.

The Climate Info device accepts the Cabin Temperature [CABINTEMP] command with two parameters: driver side temperature and passenger side temperature. Both parameters accept values in the range -50.0 to 150.0 degrees Fahrenheit with a step of 1.0 and precision of 1.

You requested to set both driver and passenger side temperatures to 72°F, which is within the allowed range.

Command to send:
- Command Name: Cabin Temperature [CABINTEMP]
- Parameter 1: Driver side Temp = 72.0 °F, Range: -50.0 to 150.0
- Parameter 2: Passenger side Temp = 72.0 °F, Range: -50.0 to 150.0

I will proceed to set the cabin temperature accordingly.
